availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky, commission merchant. Kentucky native. Married to G. P. Fowler. Father of Laura Fowler, Willie P. Fowler. Commission Merchant in McCracken County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "Dickson Given "Captain Dick" Fowler (February 3, 1830 - May 17, 1876)," Memorial #73784133, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73784133 (accessed June 2, 2017)
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 110.
Milford M. Miller, "Evansville Steamboats During the Civil War," Indiana Magazine of History Vol. 37, No. 4 (1941): 364.
